title: Parndon Wood Walking Route

images.title: Lynda Poulter / Parndon Wood Conservation Centre
images.caption: Parndon Wood Conservation. Centre Parndon Wood nature reserve has a small conservation centre, and a marked walk through the woods.

images.title: Walk in Parndon Wood Nature Reserve by Roger Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Walk in Parndon Wood Nature Reserve in autumn

images.title: View from hide, Parndon Wood Nature Reserve by Roger Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View from hide

description: This lovely nature reserve in Harlow has a 1.5km nature trail to try. It's located on the southern outskirts of the town and consists of ancient woodland, 3 bird watching hides, a large pond and a conservation centre. It's great for wildlife with deer, squirrels, and various woodland birds to look out for. You can enjoy refreshments in the centre after your walk. Two long distance walking trails run past the reserve. You can pick up the Forest Way and the Stort Valley Way to further explore the area. For example you could follow the trail south west and visit Epping Forest and Waltham Abbey.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Harlow Walk starts from the nearby Harlow Town train station and uses part of the Stort Valley Way to explore the river and the pretty Pishiobury Park in Sawbridgeworth. There's also a nice riverside pub at the end of the walk to visit. For more walking ideas in the area see the Essex Walks page.

display_address: Parndon Wood Nature Reserve Information, Long Wood, Staple Tye, Latton Bush, Harlow, Essex, England, CM18 7JD, United Kingdom
